content.question: In the <math alttext="x y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi><mi>y</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-plane, how many points on the curve <math alttext="y squared, plus x squared, equals 3 minus x y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>y</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>=</mo><mn>3</mn><mo>âˆ’</mo><mi>x</mi><mi>y</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> have horizontal or vertical tangent lines?

choices.label: No points have vertical tangent lines, and two points have horizontal tangent lines.
One point has a vertical tangent line, and one point has a horizontal tangent line.
Two points have vertical tangent lines, and two points have horizontal tangent lines.
No points have vertical tangent lines, and no points have horizontal tangent lines.

content.answer: Two points have vertical tangent lines, and two points have horizontal tangent lines.

skill.text: Skill 1.E: Apply appropriate mathematical rules or procedures, with and without technology.
